titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I spent the day at Lambeth in conference with my fellow bishops. All the four rebels were present, and all spoke.

Should we carry the Revised Book through Church Assembly and Convocations again?
Certainly through Convocations, not so certainly through Assembly, but I think so.
The real scandal of the situation is that such a decision could be reached by such an assembly after such a debate.
Yes; and we shall have to consider how far we can in future put such matters before Parliament. But we
put this forward to Parliament, and to go round some corner
would be (in justice) to flout the State, not merely to declare independence in action.

But isn't this (perhaps) a God–given opportunity for stating the aforesaid principle at stake without party or personal complications such as would inevitably exist when the issue is next raised? Hadn't we better seize it?
